Absolute Value of Sine Reduce theta so that \gcd(a,b)=1 where \theta = \frac{a\pi}{b}. What is the denominator? What is \sin(\frac{\pi}{b})? If b=1,2,3,4, or 6 and a is integer with gcd(a,b)=1 then \sin(\frac{a\pi}{b})=\pm \sin(\frac{\pi}{b}). Positive or Negative? For cosine, is \frac{a\pi}{b} on left or right? For sine, is \frac{a\pi}{b} on top or bottom? Add or subtract \frac{2b\pi}{b} until -b\lt a\lt b.

var videoPlaylist = [1]; document.getElementById('myVideo').addEventListener('ended',videoEnded,false); document.getElementById('myVideo').addEventListener('timeupdate',updateTime,false); function videoEnded() { var vid = document.getElementById('myVideo'); var newVid = false; if (videoPlaylist.length 0) { for (i=0;i0) { if (vid.getAttribute("src") == "/videos/video1.mp4") { greenRedRatio[0][0] = Math.max(vid.currentTime/(vid.duration*3-.5),greenRedRatio[0][0]); greenRed(); } else if (vid.getAttribute("src") == "/videos/video2.mp4") { greenRedRatio[1][0] = Math.max(vid.currentTime/(vid.duration*3-.5),greenRedRatio[1][0]); greenRed(); } } } function chgVideo(videoId) { var vid = document.getElementById('myVideo'); vid.src = "/videos/video"+videoId.toString()+".mp4"; }

Important angles? What is sine? Sine is a function. The input is an angle. The output is a y-coordinate. What is cosine? Cosine is a function. The input is an angle. The output is an x-coordinate.

Trigonometry What do you need to know about trigonometry to succeed in Calculus? Know the values of sine and cosine for the basic angles. Know how the other trig functions relate to sine and cosine. Know basic trig identities and how to manipulate them. Know what an inverse trig function is. Here is the chart you need to just know: xsin(x)cos(x) 001 pi/61/2sqrt(3)/2 pi/4sqrt(2)/2sqrt(2)/2 pi/3sqrt(3)/21/2 pi/210 But you really don't want to try to memorize the whole thing.

Rotate the above knob until the angle is radians. TopBottom LeftRight 1234 var angleArray = [[30,1,6],[45,1,4],[60,1,3],[120,2,3],[135,3,4],[150,5,6],[210,-5,6],[225,-3,4],[240,-2,3],[300,-1,3],[315,-1,4],[330,-1,6]]; var angleN = Math.trunc(Math.random()*12); var correctAngle = angleArray[angleN][0]; var angleSpot = document.getElementById('angleSpot'); if (angleArray[angleN][1] == 1){ katex.render("\\frac{\\pi}{"+angleArray[angleN][2].toString()+"}",angleSpot); } else if (angleArray[angleN][1] == -1){ katex.render("\\frac{-\\pi}{"+angleArray[angleN][2].toString()+"}",angleSpot); } else { katex.render("\\frac{"+angleArray[angleN][1].toString()+"\\pi}{"+angleArray[angleN][2].toString()+"}",angleSpot); } var allQuadrants = false; var rotationSnap = 90; var knobEl = document.getElementById('knobInfo'); function newQuestion() { angleN = Math.

Objectives Learn Tangent Learn Cotangent Learn Secant Learn Cosecant var html = katex.renderToString("\\sin(\\frac{\\pi}{6})"); greenRedRatio = [[0],[0],[0],[0]]; function sumArray(theArray) { var workingSum = 0 for (arri=0;arri.975) {x = 1} var fullString = allGreen.textContent+allRed.textContent; allGreen.innerHTML = fullString.substring(0,fullString.length*x); allRed.innerHTML = fullString.substring(fullString.length*x,fullString.length); if (x .975) { if (i=0) { var index = videoPlaylist.indexOf(i+1); if (index -1) { videoPlaylist.splice(index,1); } } } } else { var allColored = allObjectives.

Tangent and Cotangent \tan(\theta)=\frac{\cos(\theta)}{\sin(\theta)}. \cot(\theta)=\frac{\sin(\theta)}{\cos(\theta)}. When are these functions undefined? Secant and Cosecant \sec(\theta)=\frac{1}{\cos(\theta)}. \csc(\theta)=\frac{1}{\sin(\theta)}. When are these functions undefined? var allKatex = document.getElementsByClassName("myKatex"); for (i=0;i
